title: Spoon, 1902
markings: On reverse of bowl at join: "R" with wheel symbol for Ruckert, symbol for German mark indicating production of 1888 and later (crescent moon and crown), "800".
creditline: Museum purchase from Pauline Cooper Noyes and Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Funds
description: Small, pointed oval gilt bowl with rat-tail join on shaft with continuing engraved line ending in oval outline at base of handle that is engraved with double row of horizontal ovals continuing to engraved square with double outline. Reverse similar to 1996-106-1.

exhibitions.title: Feeding Desire: Design and the Tools of the Table, 1500-2005

tombstone.epitaph:
Spoon, 1902.
1902. silver, silver gilt. Museum purchase from Pauline Cooper Noyes and Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Funds. 1996-106-4.
